org.jpac

Class AsynchronousTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jpac.AsynchronousTask

  • public abstract class AsynchronousTask
extends java.lang.Object
    Asynchronous tasks can be used to implement long term functions which might exceed the cycle time of an elbfisch application. They can be instantiated and started by modules.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AsynchronousTask()
      constructs a asynchronous task using the class name as its identifier.
      AsynchronousTask(java.lang.String identifier)
      constructs a asynchronous task

      • AsynchronousTask

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
           throws WrongUseException
        Invokes the asynchronous task on separate thread. On first call a thread (task runner) is started which calls the doIt() method. The thread keeps running after doIt() returns. Afterwards it waits for its next invocation by start(). The thread keeps on running, until terminate() is called or the application shuts down.
        Throws:
        WrongUseException - thrown, when start() is called outside the context of a module or jPac

      • terminate

        public void terminate()
               throws WrongUseException
        Used to savely stop the task runner
        Throws:
        WrongUseException - thrown, when start() is called outside the context of a module

      • finished

        public ProcessEvent finished()
        returns a ProcessEvent which indicates the conclusion of an asynchronous task
        Returns:

      • getIdentifier

        public java.lang.String getIdentifier()
        Returns:
        the identifier of the asynchronous task

      • doIt

        public abstract void doIt()
                   throws ProcessException
        must implemented to fulfill the application specific function of this AsynchronousTask. Is called on every call of start(). The invoking module can await() its conclusion by calling asynchTask.finished.await().
        Throws:
        ProcessException

      • isFinished

        public boolean isFinished()
        Returns:
        true, if the asynchronous task has come to an end

      • getMinimumDuration

        public long getMinimumDuration()
        used to retrieve the minimum duration of doIt()
        Returns:
        the minimumDuration

      • getMaximumDuration

        public long getMaximumDuration()
        used to retrieve the maximum duration of doIt()
        Returns:
        the maximumDuration
